title: USA TODAY marks 30th annual Ad Meter competition
text:
CLOSE

Ad Meter (Photo: USA TODAY)

USA TODAY launched its Ad Meter 30th Anniversary Bracket competition today. The popular bracket-style contest, presented by Kia, celebrates three decades of its Super Bowl advertising competition, serving as an industry-leading tool used to measure public opinion regarding the game’s commercials.

Since the competition’s inception in 1989, USA TODAY’s audience has chosen their favorite Super Bowl commercials, and the program has become a fixture amongst the advertising community. With 2018 being the competition’s 30th year, USA TODAY will take a look back at previous winning ads and give its audience the chance to choose their favorite at www.admeter30.usatoday.com. Voting for ads will close on January 31st.

Winning advertisements throughout the competition’s span include Kia’s 2017 “Hero’s Journey,” as well as several winning ads from PepsiCo and Anheuser-Busch InBev.

“For 30 years, people have used Ad Meter to voice their opinions on the biggest ads of the year,” said Andy Yost, chief marketing officer, Gannett | USA TODAY NETWORK. “This year, we are excited to bring the winners of the last 29 years together for a competition to crown the best of all time. The competition is stiff, but we trust that the best will rise to the top.”

In addition to the competition, Ad Age, the leading global source of news for marketing and media communities, will feature content and articles looking back on the Ad Meter era of Super Bowl advertising and celebrating its creativity.

To vote and celebrate the 30th year of Ad Meter, please visit www.admeter30.usatoday.com.
